title.narrative: Provision of essential health and nutrition services for drought- affected population in priority districts of Takhar province.

description.narrative:
Afghanistan has been experiencing severe drought conditions since the end of 2017. According to the latest Emergency Food Security assessment (EFSA) findings a total of 21 out of 34 provinces have been affected by drought. As of September, 9.8 million people were estimated to be in Food Crisis and Emergency across Afghanistan (an Integrated food security Phase Classification Phase 3 and Phase 4) according to IPC’s October report. The proposed project aims to respond to the drought affected population through provision of integrated mobile health and nutrition services in eight priority districts of Takhar province (Taleqan, Baharak, Bangi, Rostaq, Chahab, Khwja Ghar Eshkamish and Hazarsomoch). AADA will undertake the following key interventions:
Deployment of five Mobile Health and Nutrition Teams (MHNTs) to conduct bi-monthly visits to 53 remote villages with an estimated papulation of 67,066 in Taleqan, Chahab, Rustaq, Bangi and in Khoja Ghar districts to provide Outpatient Department of Severe Acute Malnutrition (OPD-SAM), Outpatient Department of Moderate Acute Malnutrition (OPD-MAM), services to actually malnourished boys and girls (6 to 59 months) , Acutely Malnourished Pregnant and Lactating Women (AM PLW), and primary health care services to men and women, Integrated Management of Neonatal and Childhood Illnesses (IMNCI) to children under five years old age , antenatal care to pregnant women and health education.
Establishing OPD-MAM and OPD-SAM sites and breastfeeding corners in 22 Health Sub-Centers (HSCs) located in remote areas of Taleqan, Baharak, Bangi, Rostaq, Chahab, Khwja Ghar Eshkamish and Hazarsomoch districts to provide OPD-MAM and OPD-SAM services to children 6 to 59 months and AM PLWs and IYCF-E counselling The proposed action will target 50,980 direct beneficiaries including 9,494 men, 29,290 women, 5,836 boys and 6,361 girls. AADA will implement this project in coordination with all relevant actors at the national, provincial and community
